message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM, cs.RO 

This paper proposes a new framework for RGB-D-based action recognition that combines hand-designed features from skeleton data and deeply learned features from depth maps. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the computer vision (cs.CV) sub-category. Additionally, the paper uses Convolutional Neural Networks (ConvNets) and Hidden Markov Models (HMMs), which are commonly used in machine learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI) research. The paper also deals with motion data, which is relevant to multimedia (cs.MM) research. Finally, the paper's focus on recognizing actions suggests that it may be relevant to robotics (cs.RO) research.
